text: Jeannette Pickering Rankin (June 11, 1880 â€“ May 18, 1973) was an American politician and women's rights activist. She was the first woman to hold federal office in the United States. She was elected to the U.S. House of Representatives as a Republican from Montana in 1916, and again in 1940. Rankin died on May 18, 1973, at age 92, in Carmel, California. ==References== Category:1880 births Category:1973 deaths Category:United States representatives from Montana Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:People from Missoula, Montana Category:American feminists Category:American political activists
title: Jeannette Rankin
